raw_entry:
JAMES BINAM, 140 acs. (N. L.),
in Surry Co; S. side the main Black
Water Sw; on N. side of Coppohunk
Sw; down run of the Cattail Br., to his
oe 16 June 1714, p, 150. 15
Shill.

SAMUEL BRIGGS, 290 acs. (N. L.),
Surry Co; on 8. side of the main Black
Water Sw; on S. side of Bly’s Br; &
down run of Procter’s Br; 16 June
1714, p. 150. 1 Lb., 10 Shill.

THOMAS ANDREWS, JUNR., 225
acs. (N. L.), Surry Co., in Southwark
Par; adj. line of Thomas Andrews; 16
June 1714, p. 151. 1 Lb., 5 Shill.
‘CHARLES FLEMING, 732 acs. (N.
L.), Henrico Co; on N. side of James
Riv; beg. at his own land; crossing a
br. to the back river against Elk Island,
&c; 16 June 1714, p, 151. 40 Shill., &
Imp. of 7 pers: Robert Broomly, James
Dollard, Edwd. Morgan, Margt. McDaniel, Wm. Gobell, Dennis Sheehorne,
Margt. Sheppard.

THOMAS ELDRIDGE (Elderidge),
370 acs. (N. L.), Surry Co; SW side
of the Warwick Sw: S. side of the main
Blackwater Sw: on S. side of Hales’
Br., ‘ewixe this & land of William
Heath; over run of the Saw-pitt Br; to
James Minge’s land; & down run of
a a Br; 16 June 1714, p. 151. 40
hill.

NATHANIEL HARRISON, ESQR.,
310 acs. (N. L.), Surry Co; on S. side
of the main Black Water Sw; beg. on
E, side of Assamusock Sw., at mouth
of a br. that runs through the old Nottoway Town feilds to the northward of
the old fort; to land of Honble. Benjamin Harrison, Esqr., decd; by Bly’s
Br, dividing this & land of Szmuel
Briggs; 16 June 1714, p. 152. 55 Shill.

CAPT. NATHANIEL RIDLEY, 815
acs. (N. L.), Is. of Wight Co; on S.
side of Motoway River; 16 Tune 1714,
p. 152. Imp. of 17 pers: Jonn Monger,
Jonn Hood, Anne In,s'esh, Francis Lee,
Thos. ‘Wilsva, Joyce Wilson, Joan Bidgood, Daniel Mathewes, Mary Mathewes, Philip Whedon, Eliza, Harris,
John Cary, Eleanore Cary, William
Balmer, Catherine Balmer, Thomas
Hobby, Catherine Hobby.

GEORGE WILLIAMS, 260 acs. (N.
L.), Up. Par. of Surry Co; on W. side
of Stony Run; adj. William Blackburn;
Hezekiah Bunhill; Nathaniel Harrison;
Wm. Pully; Thomas Tyas; & Mr. Che.
Mozing; near the County Road; 16
June 1714, p. 152. 30 Shilf,

HENRY CLARKE, 100 acs. (N, L.),
Is. of Wight Co; on S. side of the
main Black Water Sw; on SE side of
Coshunkocraw (?) Sw; adj. Capt. Wm.
Brown; & John Wapple’s land; 16 June
1714, p. 153. 10 Shill.

JOHN SUTTON, 500 acs. (N. L.),
King Wm. Co., in St. John’s Par; on
S. side of Mattapony Riv; beg. on lower

1714, p. 153. Imp. of 10 pers: Thomas
Ballard, Tames Merritt, James Ashecum,
John Sugbery, Robt. Butler, Matthew
Blackstone, Daniel Manister, Gilbert
Smith, Charles Rider, Robert Middleton.

WILLIAM BYRD, 233 acs., (N. L.),
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; at Sumertom; adj. his own line; & land of
Thomas & John Byrd; 16 June 1714,
p. 153. Imp. of 5 pers: John Dickenson, Dorothy Mayson, Sarah Bryan, John
Mackdonnel’s wife, James Bab’s wife.

COL. THOMAS GODWIN, of Nansemond Co; 250 acs. (N. L.), Is. of
Wight Co; S. side of the main Black
Water Sw; on N. side of Black Cr.,
cor, of Barnaby Mackquinney’s land;
16 June 1714, p. 154. Imp. of 5 pers:
John Wyarey, Patrick Mackcotton, Valentine Hill, Mary Carrell, Richard
Glover.

WILLIAM GRILLS, 400 acs. (N.
L.), King Wm. Co., in St. John’s Par;

16 June 1714, p. 154. 30 Shillings, &
Imp. of 2 pers: John Born, Thomas
Robinson.
CAVALIERS AND PIONEERS

WILLIAM KEATON, 54 acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Anne Co; near the Black
Water, at Timber Neck Sw; beg. at his
own land; along Benja. Comings’ line;
16 June 1714, p. 154. Imp. of: Thomas Richards,

LEMUFL NEWTON, 48 acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Anne Co; at a place called the

emuel Newton; .George Kemp; John

Ragdale.

JAMFS BINAM, 330 acs. (N. L.),

Morris, Eliza. Morris, Junr., Mary

CHARLES SAVIDGE, 120 acs, (N.

JOHN LONG, 104 acs. (N. L.),

along line of Robert Bryant; to land of

p 156. Imp. of 2 pers: Anne Barbar,
Iohn Gouge.

STEPHEN CHASTEANE, 280. acs.
(N. L.). Henrico Co; on W, side of the
Up. Manakin Town Cr: 16 June 1714,
p. 156. 30 Shill,
ROBERT LOYDE, 123 acs. (N. L.),
Ches. City: adj. Robt. Brookes; &

acs. (N. L.). Low. Par. of Surry Co:

pers: Wm. Smitten, John Brookes,
Edwd. Curant, Duke Langdale, Wm.
Selman.

THOMAS ANDERSON, 105  acs.,
(N. L.), Pr. Geo, Co; on the Cat-taifl

10 Shill.

JOHN PLEASANTS, 541 acs. (N.
L.). Henrico Co; on brs. of Upnim

Stewart, Jno. Bombay, John Hewlet (or

order of Councill relating to this land

CHARLES JONES, 230 acs. (N. L.),
Is. of Wight Co; on S, side of the main
Black Water Sw; beg. at mouth of a
br. on S. side of the Lightwood Sw.,

Henry Weeder, Matthew Porter, Mattw.
Raysons, Geo, Gourney.

JOHN HEDGPATH, JUNR., 443
acs, (N. L.), Up. Par. of Nansemond

1714, p. 158. 45 Shill.

THOMAS TERRY, 500 acs. (N. L.),

John Ash, .Edwd. Betleson, Catherine
Connell, Richd. Griffis.

JOHN RICHARDS, 758 acs. (O. L.),
K. & Q. Co., in St. Stephen’s Par; on

Smith's land; & William Richards’

JOHN HITCHCOCK, 60 acs. (O.
L.), Jas. City Co; on W, side of Chicka-
hominy Riv; beg. on a br. of Hog-Pen
Meadow; along Thos. Rogers, to PeaseHill Run; to Thomson’s cor; 16 June
1°14, p, 159, Part of 1250 acs. granted
Edwd. Cowles, decd. in 1661 (but nor
recorded until 1711 upon petition of
Thos. Cowles, Junr.); also part of a
greater quantity conveyed by Capt.
Thomas Cowles, son & heir of sd. Edward, to sd, Hitchcock. who is in’ quiet
& peaceable possession of sd. 60 acs.,
ac,

SAMUEL DUCHIMIN, 816 acs, (0.
& N. 1.), Essex Co; about 2 mi. from
Rappa. River; beg. at patent of Robert
Pain. decd., near br. of Cockell Cr.
running into Lucas’ Cr; on line of Mrs.
Behethiern Gibson; by a Ridge Path to
Portobscca Indian Town, cor. to Mr.
Edwin Thacker; to James Cogghi!l, in
a br, of Portobacco Cr; 16 June 1714,
p. 159. $60 acs. granted Capt. Alexander Fleming, 14 Sept. 1667. Imp. of
6 pers: Henry Stapleton, Wm. Mann,
Wm. Duff. Margaret Collins, Pierce
Callee, Michael Spiller.

THOMAS YOUNG, 356 acs. (O.
L.), Jas. City Co; N. side of James
River, adj. Nicholas Moyser; Mr, Wm.
Blaikley; John Watson; & Thomas
Denkins; 16 June 1714, p. 159. Part of
$00 acs. granted Thomas Swan, Esqr..
U8 Dec. 1668, & by several conveyances
is become the inheritance of sd. Young.

CHRISTOPHER HUDSON, 98734
acs. (QO. L.). New Kent Co; 16 June
i7t4, p. 160. Due by conveyance, 387
acs, being his proportionable part of
“surplus land within bounds of patent
granted Andrew Davis, John Webb &
John Longworthy;.15 Dec. 1673. Granted by order &c.; 24 Oct. 1711; 1 Bb,
15 Shill.. & Imp. of: John Baxter.’

WILLIAM GLOVER, 100 acs, (N.
L.), Surry Co; on S. side of the main
Black Water Sw; beg. at mouth of Old

ROBERT ANDROS. 165 acs. (N.

WILLIAM ROOKINS, 94 acs. (Esch.

CHARLES EVANS, 577 acs. (N. L.).

JOHN ROGERS, PETER ROGERS,
EDWARD PIGG, JOHN YORK, &

WILLIAM GRILES, 400 acs, (N.

et mouth of the Concord Br., on §, side

CAVALIERS AND PIONEERS
Thomas Cowles, Junr.) & conveyed by

THOMAS YOUNG, 372 «cs. (Esch.

RC,

At a Council held at the Capito! the
20th of Apr. 1716. On reading at this
Bord the petition of JOHN WATSON of Henrico Co.. setting forth that
in 1713 he purchased of John Pleasaiit.
late of sd. Co., dec’d:, his right to 551
acs., surveyed for him on the N. brs.
of Upnam Brook, & praying that a
patent for same may pass in his name;
it appearing that a patent has already
heen signed for sd. land in the name of
John Pleasant, the elder, & that it was
unknown that sd. John was dead at the
time of signing, the Govr’or. & Council
think fit to declare that the patent was
never intended for the benefit of any
other person than sd. John Pleasant, the
elder, & that John, the younger, who
was the only person alive of that name
at the time of granting sd. patent, hath
not any right to the land; & it is ordered
that this declaration be entered in the
record, &c. Signed: Wil. Robertson,
Clk. Council. Marginal note: See paterit
in 197th page of this book,

by inquisition under John Lewis, Esqr.,
Eschr., 23 May 1712; for 160 acs: survey returned by Thomas Cooke, Surveyor, for 290 acs; &c. 2 Lbs. Tobacco.

Marshall setting forth that some years
ago he purchased of one Michael
Michell his risnt of a survey of 628
acs, in Henrico Co., &c; & upon application to obtain order for a patent
in his own name, by some mistake in
writeine out the patent the same issued’
in name of sd. Michell, who is long
since dead; & praying that a new patent
may issue in the name of sd, Alexander,
& if the patent to Michell be recorded
that this order be entered in the margin
to the end it may appear the land was
granted sd. Michell by mistake. Wil.
Robertson, Cl, Coun.

WILLIAM DANDRIDGE & THOMAS WYTHE, 32 poles (N. L.), Eliza.
City Co; in Hampton River, adjoyning
to Hampton Town; gained by their
industry out of the river for a Wharf;
beg. on E. side of King St; along the
river to mouth of the Cove, & joyning
a lott belonging to Wilson Curle; 11
July 1719, p. 450. Provided alwayes if
they, their heirs, &c., do not within 3
years from Aug. 1717 erect a wharf or
make other walls or improvements on
sd. ground as far as the sea now ebs,
or if upon decay thereof they shall
suffer the same to lye unrepaired & be
useless dureing the space of 3 yrs., then
the estate hereby granted shall cease, &c.,
& thereafter it may be Jawfull to grant
the same ground, &c., unto such other
person, &c. Provided also that they,
their heirs, &c., shall not at any time
hereafter enlarge the sd. Wharf beyond
the limitts herein before set down or
crect any house or edifices thereon to
the prejudice of the sd. Town, & also
it shall be lawfull to lade & unlade at
sd. Wharf all necessarys for the publick
service without paying any fee or reward, &c. 5 Shill.
